author: 8BrickMario
title: ...he's freaky and he's gloomy...
review:
Ever since the Spooky Girl's release, I was hoping for a Spooky Boy to join her. When the next yellow-bagged series rolled around, I got my wish!

Parts

The Spooky Boy's parts are very nice, featuring some nice edgy clothes and Larry's hair in black. If you needed a LEGO spider, you can get one here.

The completed model

The Spooky Boy is a bit tonally different from his predecessor, but he's still nice. Like the Girl, he's entirely monochrome. His face shows a worried or skeptical frown, sunken eyes, and a pointy tooth. Maybe he's a vampire, maybe he's just plain spooky. His torso shows a simple black t-shirt with the classic LEGO skull, and his sleeves are dual-molded. I don't think it's a coincidence that his lower sleeves are grey with black stripes, as this matches the design of Pugsley Addams' shirt. I like these subtle homages with the spooky kids.The Spooky Boy is wearing grey pants with a belt and a chain which goes around the side of his left leg. His legs are dual-molded to show heavy black boots with metal toes. 

His accessories are a simple spider, and a book of Spooky Tales. This is the older style of book, but it fits the feel of an ancient tome. 

Overall opinion

Get him! He's a great successor and companion to the Spooky Girl, and another spooky character to add to your collection.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Spooky Girl meet Spooky Boy
review:
Set #71013 Spooky Boy: You all knew it was inevitable, CMF just loves to give us male and female characters, first came the Spooky Girl and now we come to the male counterpart, the Spooky Boy.

This minifigure features dual-molded legs and arms, and much like the Spooky Girl he is mostly monochrome in design and print with grey/white and black colouring. His print features is really fun, the pants feature some light tears a long chain and his feet have boots on them. The LEGO Skeleton is on his shirt and he's got black stripes printed on his lower sleeves.

The accessories are also quite suitable, with an older LEGO Book piece printed with cobwebs and the title Spooky Tales, and a regular black spider element. his hair piece is straight black and his facial print is very somber looking with a snaggletooth sticking out one side of his mouth, perhaps this Spooky Boy has vampiric tendencies?

He's a great looking figure, I'd definitely recommend this one as a must have, especially for the parts and print details that look great and will make excellent outfit parts for mix-and-match MOC figures.
